## Central Limit Theorem

### Simulating the Central Limit Theorem

The *Central Limit Theorem* says--in one version--that the sum of a bunch of $k$ binomial variables will have a normal distribution as $k \rightarrow \infty$.

Hit the `run` button to re-run the simulation.

```{r CLT, exercise=TRUE, exercise.eval=TRUE}

mydimension <- 1000 # dimensions of the matrix

N <- mydimension * mydimension # sample size

myvalues <- rbinom(N, 1, .5) # simulate values

mymatrix <- matrix(myvalues, 
                   nrow = mydimension, 
                   ncol = mydimension) # matrix of values

mysums <- colSums(mymatrix) # sum the columns

hist(mysums, col = blues9) # histogram of sums of values

```
